intro: Cyclaminum, commonly known as the candytuft, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Cyclaminum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to bloom in early spring.
